IntroText:
Welcome to the text based adventure game, Treasure Island! To play this game you enter commands below to indicate what you want to do.  While the game will try and understand any command you type in, you are only allowed to do certain things.  You can move around by going north, south, east, west, up or down.  You can pick up or drop things, which will add or remove them from your inventory.  Sometimes you can also interact with objects, like lighting a match or drinking water.  You'll have to discover those as you go.  if  you need it, you can ask for help, but it may not always be available and if it is, will count against your score.

As a fun feature, you can have AI embellish the location descriptions.  Type the command: embellish to turn it on or off. While fun, it will take a bit longer for the system to respond, and sometimes those descriptions are a bit less than accurate.

You have walked from the farm to town because you are worried about Uncle Herman.  You haven't heard from him since he let treasure hunting some months ago.  You are standing on a hilltop overlooking town.

Locations.Name: Hilltop
Locations.Description: You are standing on a hilltop. You can see a quaint village down the hill to the south.

Locations.Name: Road
Locations.Description: You are on the road which leads down to the village at the bottom of the hill.

Locations.Name: TownEntrance
Locations.Description: You are at the end of the road at the bottom of the hill, just ouside of town.

Locations.Name: Northend
Locations.Description: You are at the north end of town.  The main street stretches south that eventually leads to a pier at the edge of the ocean. A boat is tied up at the pier and there is a ticket booth there.  On the way to the wharf are several shops and cross streets.

Locations.Name: PostOffice
Locations.Description: The building itself is a simple, single-story structure constructed from coral stone, its whitewashed walls reflecting the harsh Caribbean sunlight. A small, shaded porch offers respite from the heat, where patrons can wait their turn. Inside, the air is cool and dim, the only light filtering through the open doorway and a few small, barred windows. The postmaster, a stern-faced man in a sweat-stained linen shirt, presides over a cluttered desk piled high with letters, parcels, and official documents. He meticulously sorts through the mail, his quill scratching across a ledger as he records each item.  The scent of sealing wax and parchment hangs heavy in the air. A motley crew of customers fills the small space. A wealthy plantation owner waits impatiently to send news of his sugar crop to London. A sailor, fresh off a voyage from Jamaica, eagerly collects a letter from his sweetheart. A nervous young clerk delivers a packet of official dispatches from the Governor's mansion. The walls are adorned with a jumble of notices and proclamations. A tattered map of the Caribbean hangs beside a list of postal rates to far-flung destinations like Boston and Bristol. A royal decree announces the latest regulations on trade and shipping. Despite its humble appearance, the post office is a hub of activity, a vital artery in the flow of information and commerce that binds the colony to the mother country. Here, news of wars and peace, fortunes made and lost, births and deaths, all pass through the hands of the postmaster, connecting lives across vast distances.  There is a letter waiting for you here.

Locations.Name: Bank
Locations.Description: The air hangs heavy with the scent of salt, spices, and the ever-present rum.  Amidst the raucous taverns and bustling merchant stalls lining the harbor, stands a sturdy, imposing building of coral stone, its facade bleached white by the relentless sun. This is the Exchange and Deposit Bank, a bastion of wealth and security in this rough and tumble port city. Iron bars guard the windows, and a heavy oak door, reinforced with iron bands, marks the entrance. Stepping inside, one is struck by the cool, dim interior. Thick walls keep out the heat, and sunlight struggles to penetrate the small, high windows. The air is heavy with the scent of ink, parchment, and beeswax. Dominating the room is a long, polished mahogany counter, behind which clerks with meticulously penned ledgers attend to their business.  Scales and strongboxes rest atop the counter, ready to weigh coins and store valuables.  Behind the counter, a massive iron door, secured by multiple locks, hints at the treasures within the vault. A diverse clientele populates the bank.  A rough-hewn buccaneer, fresh from a raid on a Spanish galleon, deposits a sack overflowing with gold doubloons.  A finely dressed sugar planter negotiates a loan to expand his estate. A nervous widow, clutching a small purse, seeks to withdraw funds for her passage back to England. The walls are adorned with notices of exchange rates for various currencies – Spanish reales, Portuguese escudos, English pounds.  Proclamations from the Governor warn against counterfeiting and announce new regulations on trade and finance. Despite the air of stability and order, an undercurrent of tension permeates the bank. This is a world where fortunes are made and lost overnight, where pirates and privateers roam the seas, and where the threat of invasion or natural disaster always looms. Yet, the bank stands as a symbol of enduring prosperity and a testament to the growing economic power of the Caribbean colonies.  There is a surpsing amount of money within reach.
Locations.Help: Stealing money might not be a good idea.  You could get caught and thrown in jail.  Perhaps there is another way to get some money if you keep exploring.

Locations.Name: MainStreet
Locations.Description: You are near the center of town.  On one side an alley between the bank and the jail on the other side you smell delicious donuts wafting your way from the bakery. Toward the ocean is another city block, which eventually ends up at the wharf.

Locations.Name: Bakery
Locations.Description: You are at the town bakery, Marguerite smiles as she offers you her wares.
Locations.Help: Those donuts might come in handy.

Locations.Name: BankAlley
Locations.Description: You are in an alley between the bank and the jail. On one side the south wall of the bank, the other is the north wall of the jail.  The alley stretches a bit further.

Locations.Name: AlleyEnd
Locations.Description: You are farther into an alley between the bank and the jail.  On one side is the south wall of the bank, the other is the north wall of the jail.  The alley ends in a wall here.  There are some bushes growing on the side of the alley, and you think you can see something under them.

Locations.Name: CenterStreet
Locations.Description: You are at the center of town.  On one side is the jail, and the other is the church. The street stretches in both directions.  Toward the ocean is another city block, which eventually ends up at the wharf.

Locations.Name: Church
Locations.Description: A small but well cared for church is the spiritual center of town.
Locations.Help: Praying is alaways a good idea.

Locations.Name: JailVisitor
Locations.Description: Currently there are no prisoners in the jail.  You pity the poor sole condemed to this small cage.  It looks like there would be no escape.

Locations.Name: JailCell
Locations.Description: You look around is dismay.  You are in small room with bars on the window and wall of bars on the other side.  How will you ever help Uncle Herman now?
Locations.Help: Unfortunately, there is not much to do now.  In future versions of the game we might add a jail escape!

Locations.Name: KingStreet
Locations.Description: You are close to the center of town.  On one side is the constables office, the other, the pawn shop. The street stretches in both directions.

Locations.Name: PawnShop
Locations.Description: The pawn shop is packed full of various odds and ends.  The owner, a rather small, dark haired fellow, eyes you suspiciously.

Locations.Name: ConstablesOffice
Locations.Description: A rather self important looking man who is clearly the law in town looks you over.  He finally says, 'At your service.'  There are several notices of wanted posters and rewards.
Locations.Help: Perhaps take a closer look at the notices on the wall.

Locations.Name: CrossStreet
Locations.Description: You are south of the center of town.  On one side is the  Stage Coach depot, and the other is the fortune teller. You can head up to the road out of town, or towards the ocean.

Locations.Name: FortuneTeller
Locations.Description: The structure is a modest wooden shack with weathered, deep blue paint and a thatched roof. Tattered curtains of rich crimson and indigo drape over the entrance, and faint, wafting smoke from incense and herbs gives it a mystical air. Inside, the dim room is lined with shelves bearing worn leather-bound books, jars filled with strange roots and powders, and crystal orbs that shimmer in the candlelight. A small, round table at the center, covered with a velvet cloth, holds an array of tarot cards, runes, and an intricate brass pendulum. The fortune teller, draped in layered shawls and adorned with charms and amulets, greets visitors with a knowing smile, offering glimpses into fates entwined with the seas, storms, and secrets of the Caribbean.

Locations.Name: StageCoachDepot
Locations.Description: You didn't realize that there was a stage coach in town!  But, when you look into the destinations, it seems to stop at the various farm communities in the interior of the island.  Looks like you could've ridden the coach into town instead of walking.  Nice to know, but it won't help you now.  Unless you wish to go home and abandon Uncle Herman.  There is a friendly clerk willing to sell you a ticket.  The actual coach itself is further to the west.

Locations.Name: StageCoach
Locations.Description: You've never ridden a coach before, and the interior looks comfortable.

Locations.Name: QueensAve
Locations.Description: You are south of the center of town.  On one side is a building with no name, and on the other is the law office. You can head up to the road out of town, or towards the ocean.

Locations.Name: UknownBuilding
Locations.Description: This a small, simple house standing humbly in front of you. It’s built mostly from wood and materials gathered from around the island, with a roof made from woven palm leaves or wooden shingles that offer some shade from the bright, hot sun and the frequent rains. The walls are plain, not solid like stone or brick, but formed from wooden slats or panels made from cane, allowing a little air to flow through. If you ran your hand along the wall, you’d feel the roughness of the wood, weathered from the salt air. Now, if you reach out to where the windows would be, you won’t feel glass. Instead, you’ll find simple shutters made from wood. They can swing open to let in the cool breeze, but they close tightly to keep out the rain. Underfoot, the floor inside is either the packed earth of the island or rough wooden planks that might feel uneven beneath your feet. Inside, it’s a single open space, very plain and functional. The few pieces of furniture are made from local wood—a table with sturdy benches or stools for sitting, and perhaps a few shelves for storing essentials. You might feel the hammock hanging in a corner, which serves as a bed, or a cot that can be folded away. If you step back outside, you’d notice a small area nearby, like an open shed, where cooking happens. There’s a small fire pit, with pots for cooking meals and a place to gather, sparing the house from the heat and smoke.  Nothing here it seems.

Locations.Name: LawOffice
Locations.Description:
You are in a fine, but stuffy office.  There is an old distinguished gentlemen behind a large desk.  He looks sternly down at you, and says: 'A serendipitous meeting!  I needed to get a message to your father. The farm is behind on it's mortgage.  Unless you pay soon, the bank has ordered me to foreclose.'

It seems you have nother reason to hurry to treasure island.

Locations.Name: Southend
Locations.Description: You are at the south end of town.  On one side is the trash pit.  The other side leads to the airport, where you can go in a hot air balloon.

Locations.Name: Airport
Locations.Description: Growing up on the farm you never imaged that people could fly!  It seems an amazing adventure!  Could you fly to Uncle Herman?.  The balloon is just to the east.

Locations.Name: Balloon
Locations.Description: You step up the basket at the bottom of the balloon, wondering if you are ready to fly!  Just tell the pilot to go up when are ready.

Locations.Name: Flying
Locations.Description: At first terror grips you as you see the ground fall away from you.  After a few moments, a sense of awe and wonder fills your sould as you experience the world as the birds do.  You should look around and enjoy the view.

Locations.Name: Crashed
Locations.Description: The pilot screams the scream of the dying!  A huge tear has opened in the side of the balloon and you plummet to the ground.  Your last thought is: 'At least this is a good death.'  Game Over.

Locations.Name: TrashPit
Locations.Description: You are standing in the town trash pit.  The smell of decaying fish is overwhelming.  You are wondering why you can here, when you think you see something inside the reamins of a broken old bookshelf.

Locations.Name: WharfRoad
Locations.Description: You are at the sound end of town. On one side is the and the other is the ocean. To the south is the dock of the wharf, and north heads into town.

Locations.Name: Wharf
Locations.Description: You are standing on the dock at the wharf.  The water is a bit rough and the waves are crashing against the pilings.  The air is heavy with the smell of salt and the sound of the ocean.  To the south the ocean stretches out before you.  On one side is the ticket booth, and the other is the beach.

Locations.Name: Beach
Locations.Description: A gorgeous expanse of ocean is to your south, and you wonder where in that vast ocean is Uncle Herman.  Back to the east is the wharf, and the boat.
Locations.Help: Is that a shark in the water?

Locations.Name: TicketBooth
Locations.Description: You are standing on the dock at the ticket booth.  Th old sailor behind the counter speaks, and you think it might be words, but you can't be sure.  Luckily the sign indicates that a ticket for the boat is 5 gold.  North of you the boat lies docked.

Locations.Name: Boat
Locations.Description: You walk up the gangplank to the HMS Erwin.  It is a fine ship with a fine crew, and you wonder where it may take you.  Hopefully to Uncle Herman and treasure.  You can go below decks to your cabin.

Locations.Name: BoatCabin
Locations.Description: What is surprising is how low the ceiling is, and how small the cabin is.  But at least you have your own hammock.

Locations.Name: SharkBay
Locations.Description: You are committed to the idea that swimming to find Uncle Herman is right course of action.  You dive into the water and start swimming.  The water is cold and the waves are rough.  You are not a strong swimmer and you are quickly exhausted.  Just when you think it would be a good idea to turn back you see the shark fin.  You are eaten by a great white shark and die.  Game Over.

Locations.Name: ShipWreckBeach
Locations.Description: You are on a beautiful clear stretch of sand. Off to one side is remains of the ship you boarded.  There is no sign of the crew.  To other side, you see the edge of a lagoon through the trees.  There is also clear trail heading off into the interior of the island through the jungle.  It seems this island may have some inhabitants.  You remember Uncle Herman's warning about cannibals.

Locations.Name: Lagoon
Locations.Description: A turquiose lagoon stretches out before you to the north.  The water is clear and you can see the bottom.  You wonder if there are fish to catch.  To the east is the beach, and to the west is desne impenetrable jungle.

Locations.Name: LagoonSwimming
Locations.Description: The water is clear, calm, and refreshing—swimming was the perfect choice. You feel a surge of energy, ready to tackle whatever challenges lie ahead. Gazing down, you can almost see the bottom, catching a glint of something shiny in the depths. Just as curiosity stirs, a flicker of movement crosses your vision, hinting at something else lurking beneath the surface.

Locations.Name: LagoonDepths
Locations.Description: You are pleasently suprised with your ability to reach the bottom of the lagoon.  There is a gaint oyster open before you, and gleaming inside is a giant pearl. Do you dare to try and grab it?

Locations.Name: LagoonShark
Locations.Description: You feel a sudden, chilling awareness ripple through you—a warning you should have heeded when you noticed movement before. But it’s too late. Out of nowhere, a massive shadow surges beneath you, and in a heartbeat, a powerful jaw clamps around you. The shock cuts through your mind—how could there even be a great white shark in this lagoon? Before you can react, darkness closes in. Game Over.

Locations.Name: OceanHomeward
Locations.Description: 'Coming here was a terrible mistake!' you think, heart pounding. Driven by a surge of desperation, you dive into the water, swimming with every ounce of strength, the only plan in your mind to escape back home. But as you plunge deeper, a horrifying realization dawns—the true reason for your ship's demise and the eerie absence of your crew lies ahead. In the murky depths, a colossal kraken awaits, lurking just beyond sight. The moment you reach the open water, its tentacles wrap around you, sealing your fate. Game Over.

Locations.Name: ShipWreck
Locations.Description: The remains of your ship.  It will never sail again.  You wonder if there is anything left of value.

Locations.Name: JungleTrail
Locations.Description: The change from the beach is startling. It is suddenly dark with the dense vegetation overhead, and the heat and humidity are oppressive. You wonder what might be waiting for you along this trail.

Locations.Name: DenseJungle
Locations.Description: The plants press in all around you.  The heat and humidity are oppressive.  You can't see the sky, and you can't see the sun.  You can't see anything but the dense vegetation. You are lost in the jungle.

Locations.Name: JungleFork
Locations.Description: The trail through the jungle arrives at an intersection.  You have your choice of north, south, east or west.

Locations.Name: JungleCliff
Locations.Description: You are at the base of a rocky climb.

Locations.Name: GrassyPlateau
Locations.Description: This open, soft grassy plateau is literally a breath of fresh air compared to the jungle.  Seems like a wonderful place to take rest.

Locations.Name: JungleView
Locations.Description: You reach the top of the cliff.  All around you is dense jungle.  You are surprised to see what appears to be a mansion in the distance; defiantly resisting the jungle.

Locations.Name: ZigZagTrail
Locations.Description: This trail winds back and forth across a jungle hillside. To the north is a giant footprint, and to the south is a fork in the trail.  An ominous volcano rises to the west, and to the east is a dense jungle.

Locations.Name: EastWestTrail
Locations.Description: You are on an east-west trail through the jungle.

Locations.Name: EdgeOfClearing
Locations.Description: You are at the edge of a clearing in the jungle.  The jungle is dense to the south and west. By the looks of the village, you believe that they may be headhunters, or the cannibals Uncle Herman warned you about.  It could be dangerous to enter unprepared.
Locations.Help: The natives are terrifed of stuffed animals.  You may be able to find one else where on the island.

Locations.Name: GiantFootprint
Locations.Description: You are standing in a giant footprint.  It is so large that you could lie down in it and still have room.  To the west is an area that looks sandy and wet.

Locations.Name: SandyTrail
Locations.Description: You take a tentative step onto the sandy trail.  Unfortunately, it is quicksand and you are sucked under.  You struggle valiantly, but to no avail.  Game Over.

Locations.Name: TwinPalms
Locations.Description: Two tall palm trees cross each other like an X.  'X' marks the spot?

Locations.Name: Volcano
Locations.Description: You are standing on the rim of a giant volcano. There is much steam rising from the crater. You can see a huge hole in the ground just inside the crater which seems to go down a long way.

Locations.Name: GentleSlope
Locations.Description: You are on a gentle downhill slope. To the north is a grassy plateau. To the east and west is more of the same dense jungle. And to the south is jungle but if you go down, you can find a creek.

Locations.Name: Creek
Locations.Description: You are at a creek full of water. To the north is a gentle downhill slope. To the east and west is more of the same dense jungle. To the south is the south side of the creek. There is a jungle vine here.

Locations.Name: SouthCreek
Locations.Description: You are on the south side of a creek full of water. To the north is the creek. To the east and west is more of the same dense jungle. To the south is a large clearing. There is a jungle vine here.

Locations.Name: LargeClearing
Locations.Description: You are in a large clearing. To the north is the south side of a creek. To the east and south is more of the same dense jungle. To the west is the yard of a mansion. It looks old but seems to be in good shape.

Locations.Name: MansionYard
Locations.Description: You are the yard of the mansion. To the north and south is dense jungle. To the east is a large clearing. To the west is the front porch of the mansion. There is a gate across the path that leads to the porch.

Locations.Name: MansionPorch
Locations.Description: You are the porch of the mansion. To the north and south is dense jungle. To the east is the front yard. To the west is the open front door of the mansion.

Locations.Name: EastHall
Locations.Description: You are at the east end of a hallway. To the north is a sitting room. To the east is the porch. To the south is the pantry. To the west is the west end of that hallway. Above you is a stairway that leads up to the second floor.

Locations.Name: WestHall
Locations.Description: You are at the west end of a hallway. To the north is the library. To the east is the east end of the hallway. To the south is the kitchen.

Locations.Name: Pantry
Locations.Description: You in the pantry. To the north is the east end of the hallway. To the west is the kitchen.

Locations.Name: SittingRoom
Locations.Description: You in the sitting room. To the south is the east end of the hallway. To the west is the kitchen. There is a safe here but the door is closed. Inside is money and it is worth 100 points to you if you can figure out how to get the combination to the safe.
Locations.Help: The combination is not available in the mansion.

Locations.Name: Kitchen
Locations.Description: You are in the kitchen. To the north is the west hallway. To the east is pantry. To the south is the maids quarters. To the west is the back yard.

Locations.Name: MaidsQuarters
Locations.Description: You are in the maids quarters. To the north is the kitchen. It seems the maid collects old coins because these are from the 19th century and are worth 50 points to you.

Locations.Name: Library
Locations.Description: You are in the library. To the north is the trophy room. To the east is sitting room. To the south is the west hallway. To the west is the hidden room.

Locations.Name: TrophyRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the trophy room. To the north is the office. To the the south is the library. There are a number of stuffed dead animals mounted on the wall.

Locations.Name: Office
Locations.Description: You are in the office. To the south is the trophy room. There is a treasure here worth 100 points.

Locations.Name: HiddenRoom
Locations.Description: By a stroke of extreme luck, you discover this hidden room. It was because you took a book off the shelf in the library. To the east is the library. And to the south is a secret passage that you are dying to explore. Who knows where it leads?

Locations.Name: Backyard
Locations.Description: You are now in the back yard. To the east is the kitchen. To the west is the tool shed. There are several things there that you will need at various times as you explore Treasure Island.

Locations.Name: ToolShed
Locations.Description: You are in the tool shed. To the east is the back yard. There are several things here that you will need.

Locations.Name: Landing
Locations.Description: You are on a landing at the top of the stairway. To the west is a hallway. There is a stairway that goes up to the attic. And the stairway you just came up goes back down to the first floor.

Locations.Name: Attic
Locations.Description: You are in the attic. There is a stairway that goes down to the landing. There is a lot of junk here but your eagle eye spots something that you recognize. You can see that this painting is of Whistler's Father and while worth millions, it will bring you 400 points in this game.

Locations.Name: UpstairsHall
Locations.Description: You are in the upstairs hallway. To the north is the master bedroom. To the south is the slippery room. Beware of the slippery room because it steals all your possessions. To the east is the second floor landing.

Locations.Name: MasterBedroom
Locations.Description: You are in the master bedroom. It appears that no one has slept here for many years. To the south is the hall. To the west is coffin room.

Locations.Name: CoffinRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the coffin room. The coffin is open and you can see the body of Count Dracula lying there. You suddenly realize that he is vulnerable and must be killed immediately. To do that requires a wooden stake and a hammer to drive it down into his chest. To the south is the chain room. To the east is the master bedroom. But suddenly, with a tremendous roar, a huge steel door crashes down between you and the master bedroom, permanently blocking your way there.

Locations.Name: ChainRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the chain room. To the north is the coffin room. To the south is the bone room. To the west is the balcony over the back yard. You see that all around the room are chains attached to the walls.

Locations.Name: Balcony
Locations.Description: You are on the balcony over the back yard. To the east is the chain room. If you are carrying anything there is something that you must do here to avoid losing it in the slippery room when you go through there.
Locations.Help: Throw items down to the backyard to save them from the slippery room.

Locations.Name: BoneRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the bone room. There is a skeleton here leaning against the west wall. You immediately recognize Uncle Hermans ruby ring on one of the fingers. To the north is the chain room and to the east is the slippery room. Beware of the slippery room because it will steal everything that you are carrying. The ruby ring is worth 150 points.

Locations.Name: SlipperyRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the slippery room. Unfortunately, it steals anything and everything that you are carrying. There is no way to recover any of these items. To the north is the hall. To the west is the bone room.

Locations.Name: NativeVillage
Locations.Description: You are in the native village of headhunters. To the north is the edge of a clearing. To the south is a north-south path. The natives see the dead black cat that you are carrying and run away in fear. You suddenly observe that there is a stone idol here that they worship and around its neck is an emerald necklace. It is worth 150 points.
Locations.Help: You need the dead black cat or the natives will kill you.

Locations.Name: NorthSouthPath
Locations.Description: You are on a north-south path through the jungle.

Locations.Name: RescueBeach
Locations.Description: You are on rescue beach. To the north, east, and south is jungle. To the west is the north-south path. This place extremely important to you because this is the spot where you must drop all of the treasures, one at a time, to gain points for your score. Points will not be awarded until dropped here. Also, there is a treasure buried here but you need a shovel to dig for it.
Locations.Help: This is where you drop treasures to score points. Try digging if you have a shovel.

Locations.Name: Cavern
Locations.Description: You are in a cavern. To the west is the north-south path. To the east is the east end of a wild boar's den. It is dark here and if you have the flashlight, you better turn it on.

Locations.Name: EastBoarDen
Locations.Description: You are in the east wild boar room. To the east is a cavern. To the west is the west wild boar room. The boar is very ferocious and may cause you trouble if he appears. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: The boar loves donuts. If you have some, he will eat them and leave you alone.

Locations.Name: Ocean
Locations.Description: You are standing at the edge of the ocean. The water stretches out before you.

Locations.Name: SecretPassage
Locations.Description: You are in a secret passage at the top of a stairway. To the north is the hidden room. Down below you is the west cellar.

Locations.Name: WestCellar
Locations.Description: You are in the west cellar of the mansion. To the east is the east cellar. Above you is a long stairway leading up to the secret passage. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: EastCellar
Locations.Description: You are in the east cellar of the mansion. To the west is the west cellar. To the south is a tunnel leading into a vast underground system of caverns. There is something here that you will need but it is currently empty. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: You will need to fill the canteen with water. But finding it underground will take some doing.

Locations.Name: Tunnel1
Locations.Description: You are in a tunnel that leads deep into the ground. To the north is the east cellar. To the south is a low crawl. It is dark here and if you have the flashlight, you better turn it on.
Locations.Help: You cannot pass through the low crawl if carrying the shovel - it is too large.

Locations.Name: LowCrawl
Locations.Description: You are in a low crawl. To the north is the tunnel. To the east is a high place. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: HighPlace
Locations.Description: You are in a high place. To the east is a circular cavern. To the south is a jagged cavern. To the west is a low crawl. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: CircularCavern
Locations.Description: You are in a circular cavern. To the north is a tunnel. To the west is a high place. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: Tunnel2
Locations.Description: You are in a tunnel. To the north is a rail switch. To the south is a circular cavern. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: RailSwitch
Locations.Description: You are at a rail switch. To the north is a dead end shaft. To the east is northeast fork. To the south is a tunnel. There is a sign here that reads: We always wanted to put a rail system in here but ran out of money. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: DeadendShaft
Locations.Description: You are at deadend shaft. To the south is rail switch. There is a small rusty locomotive here. And there is a sign here that reads: We regret abandoning this underground rail system in here but we just ran out of money. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: NortheastFork
Locations.Description: You are at northeast fork. To the east is angle bend. To the west is rail switch. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: AngleBend
Locations.Description: You are at angle bend. To the west is northeast fork. There is some dynamite here. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: JaggedCavern
Locations.Description: You are in a jagged cavern. To the north is the high place. To the east is the clean room. To the west is the fissure room. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: CleanRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the clean room. To the north is a dusty passage. To the west is the jagged cavern. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: DustyPassage
Locations.Description: You are in a dusty passage. To the north is the steam room. To the south is the clean room. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: SteamRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the steam room. To the north is the rainbow room. To the east is the bamboo room. To the south is the dusty passage. To the west is a large cavern. There is a lot of steam everywhere here. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: If your matches are wet, get some more because you will need them. And avoid the steam room until you use them.

Locations.Name: RainbowRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the rainbow room. To the east is the east rainbow room. To the south is the steam room. A sign here says: Once a native looked up through a hole in the ceiling here and he saw a rainbow in the sky. But an earthquake later filled in the hole so that the sky can no longer be seen. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: EastRainbowRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the east rainbow room. To the west is the rainbow room. There is a sign here that says: Once a native looked up through a hole in the ceiling here and he saw a rainbow in the sky. But an earthquake later filled in the hole so that the sky can no longer be seen. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: BambooRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the bamboo room. To the east is the mushroom room. To the west is the steam room. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: MushroomRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the mushroom room. To the north is the small room. To the west is the bamboo room. There are a number of mushrooms growing here and you suddenly realize that you are hungry. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: Do not eat the mushrooms - they are poisonous!

Locations.Name: SmallRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the small room. To the south is the mushroom room. There is a parrot chained to the wall by one leg and he begins to talk in numbers that he repeats over and over. You suddenly realize that the numbers sound like the combination to a safe, so you memorize them. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: LargeCavern
Locations.Description: You are in a large cavern. To the east is the steam room. To the west is a historical marker. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: HistoricalMarker
Locations.Description: You are at a historical marker. To the north is a battlefield. To the east is a large cavern. To the west is goblin valley. There is a sign here that says: Beware of the battlefield because there are unexploded mines there. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: Do not go to the battlefield!

Locations.Name: Battlefield
Locations.Description: You are on a battlefield. There are unexploded mines here. Before you can say: OOPS, one of them goes off and you are blown to bits. Game Over.

Locations.Name: GoblinValley
Locations.Description: You are at goblin valley. To the north is the tv room. To the east is a historical marker. There is a treasure here worth 300 points once you drop it at rescue beach. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: TVRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the tv room. To the south is goblin valley. There are reruns of I Love Lucy on the tv set. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: WestBoarDen
Locations.Description: You are in the west wild boar room. To the east is the east wild boar room. To the south is the stalactite room. The boar is ferocious and may cause you trouble if he appears. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: The boar loves donuts. If you have some, he will eat them and leave you alone.

Locations.Name: StalactiteRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the stalactite room. To the east is sandstone. To the north is the west wild boar room. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: Sandstone
Locations.Description: You are at sandstone. To the north is the arabian room. To the south is dead mans gulch. To the west is stalactite. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: DeadmansGulch
Locations.Description: You are at deadmans gulch. To the north is sandstone. There is a treasure here worth 200 points on rescue beach. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: ArabianRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the arabian room. To the north is the east end of an ice cave. To the south is sandstone. There is a very old and curious lamp here. I suspect it may have belonged to a person called Aladdin. And it is worth 300 points on rescue beach. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: Aladdin's lamp can only be used once.

Locations.Name: EastIceCave
Locations.Description: You are in the east end of an ice cave. To the east is a windy passage. To the south is the arabian room. To the west is the west end of this ice cave. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: WindyPassage
Locations.Description: You are in a windy passage. To the north is sulphur springs. To the west is the east end of an ice cave. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: SulphurSprings
Locations.Description: You are at sulphur springs. To the north is the chimney room. To the south is the windy passage. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: ChimneyRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the chimney room. To the south is sulphur springs. To the west is bubbling cauldron. Be careful there because it is very hot. The room in which you now stand is like a huge chimney that goes up out of sight. It looks like it may even go all the way to the top of the volcano. You will need this shovel elsewhere. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: There is a sneaky method to get the shovel out of the caverns at the end.

Locations.Name: BubblingCauldron
Locations.Description: You are in bubbling cauldron. This is the bottom of the volcano crater and it is full of molten lava. It is so hot that you die immediately. Game Over.

Locations.Name: WestIceCave
Locations.Description: You are in the west ice cave. To the north is the salt room. To the east is the east end of this cave. To the south is a sloping corridor. There are two things you must do here. Both involve matches. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: Use matches here for something important.

Locations.Name: SlopingCorridor
Locations.Description: You are in a sloping corridor. To the north is the west ice cave. To the south is the fissure room. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: FissureRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the fissure room. To the north is a sloping corridor. To the east is a jagged cavern. To the west is the west fissure room. There is a treasure here that is worth 400 points if you drop it on rescue beach. But there is a wide fissure between you and the treasure and it is too wide to jump over. You will have to find some other way to get there. And you cannot use Aladdins lamp more than one time. The melting ice has filled up the fissure with water. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: You need to find a way across the water-filled fissure. Aladdin's lamp can only be used once.

Locations.Name: SaltRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the salt room. To the south is the west ice cave. To the west is lava lounge. The salt is making you very thirsty. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: You need water from the canteen to quench your thirst.

Locations.Name: LavaLounge
Locations.Description: You are in lava lounge. To the east is the salt room. To the south is echo canyon. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: EchoCanyon
Locations.Description: You are in echo canyon. To the north is lava lounge. To the south is a coal mine. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: CoalMine
Locations.Description: You are in a coal mine. To the north is echo canyon. To the south is the west fissure. You will need coal. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: Take the coal - you will need it.

Locations.Name: WestFissureRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the west fissure room. To the north is the coal mine. To the east is fissure. To the west is cut stone. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: CutStone
Locations.Description: You are at cut stone. To the east is west fissure. To the west is the tomb room. It is dark here.

Locations.Name: TombRoom
Locations.Description: You are in the tomb room. To the east is cut stone. There is a tomb here that has been opened and everything that was in it has been removed. The tomb is obviously one that held ancient egyptian pharaohs like King Tut. There is also a very old parchment map here that tells valuable information. It is dark here.
Locations.Help: Take the parchment map - it contains valuable information.

Items.Name: bushes
Items.Description: A clump of bushes is growing in the alley.  You think you see something under them.

Items.Name: letter
Items.Description:
This is a letter from your uncle:
"Please help me!  I am being held captive on treasure island by a tribe of cannibals and they are planning to eat me!  You can save if you come quickly.  There is also treasure!  Plenty for both of us.  Uncle Herman"

Items.Name: money
Items.Description: This is a lot of money.  You could use it to buy a ticket to a boat and go to treasure island to find your uncle.

Items.Name: wallet
Items.Description: This wallet has a letter of identification and several gold coins.  Be careful using money from a wallet that is not yours.

Items.Name: chest
Items.Description: It is old and broken, but seems it was once of good quality.  You think you see something inside.

Items.Name: danish
Items.Description: A tasty cream tart with berries.

Items.Name: donuts
Items.Description: Nature's perfect food.

Items.Name: coffee
Items.Description: Nothing fresher than this.

Items.Name: ticket
Items.Description: This will get you on the boat so you can go searching for Uncle Herman and treasure.

Items.Name: StageTicket
Items.Description: This will get you on the stage coach to the interior of the island.

Items.Name: notices
Items.Description: One notice in particular catches your eye.  There is a reward offered for a lost wallet.

Items.Name: therepublic pawned
Items.Description: You pawned this off, but can buy it back.

Items.Name: monkeysPaw
Items.Description: A withered, mummified monkey's paw with one curled finger remaining. Madame Isadora warns that it grants but a single wish, and even that comes at a price. 'Choose wisely,' she whispers, 'for you only get one chance.'

Items.Name: BalloonTicket
Items.Description: You need this to fly.

Items.Name: PromissoryNote
Items.Description: You have to pay back a loan to the bank.  Once you get back from treasure island, they may take a bit of treasure.

Items.Name: pearl
Items.Description: A giant pearl.  You could sell this for a lot of money. Did Uncle Herman know this was here?

Items.Name: BrokenSeaChest
Items.Description: This is the remains of a sea chest.  It is broken but there are some matches inside.

Items.Name: TreasureChest
Items.Description: The mother load!  Gold, silver and jewels.

Items.Name: matches
Items.Description: A box of wooden matches. These could be useful in dark places.

Items.Name: flashlight
Items.Description: A battery powered flashlight. Perfect for exploring dark caves.

Items.Name: woodenStake
Items.Description: A sharp wooden stake. Looks like it could kill a vampire.

Items.Name: hammer
Items.Description: A heavy hammer. Useful for driving stakes.

Items.Name: shovel
Items.Description: A sturdy shovel. Perfect for digging.

Items.Name: deadBlackCat
Items.Description: A stuffed dead black cat. The natives are terrified of this.

Items.Name: rustyRifle
Items.Description: An old rusty rifle. It probably doesn't work anymore.

Items.Name: bundleOfBills
Items.Description: A bundle of old bills from the safe. Worth 100 points.

Items.Name: coins
Items.Description: Old coins from the 19th century. Worth 50 points.

Items.Name: stocksAndBonds
Items.Description: Valuable stocks and bonds. Worth 100 points.

Items.Name: pricelessPainting
Items.Description: A painting of Whistler's Father. While worth millions, it will bring you 400 points in this game.

Items.Name: rubyRing
Items.Description: Uncle Herman's ruby ring. Worth 150 points.

Items.Name: emeraldNecklace
Items.Description: An emerald necklace from the stone idol. Worth 150 points.

Items.Name: potOfGold
Items.Description: A pot of gold buried at rescue beach. Worth 300 points.

Items.Name: jungleVine
Items.Description: A strong jungle vine hanging across the creek. You can grab it to swing across.

Items.Name: safe
Items.Description: A locked safe. You need the combination to open it.

Items.Name: coffin
Items.Description: An open coffin containing Count Dracula.

Items.Name: bookshelf
Items.Description: An old broken bookshelf in the trash pit. You think you see something inside.

Items.Name: canteen
Items.Description: An empty canteen. You will need to fill it with water.

Items.Name: dynamite
Items.Description: Dangerous dynamite. Do not touch!

Items.Name: mushrooms
Items.Description: Colorful mushrooms growing in the cavern. They look tempting but could be poisonous.

Items.Name: goblinTreasure
Items.Description: A treasure from goblin valley. Worth 300 points at rescue beach.

Items.Name: deadmansTreasure
Items.Description: A treasure from deadmans gulch. Worth 200 points at rescue beach.

Items.Name: aladdinsLamp
Items.Description: A very old and curious lamp that may have belonged to Aladdin. Worth 300 points at rescue beach. Can only be used once.

Items.Name: fissureTreasure
Items.Description: A treasure from the fissure room. Worth 400 points at rescue beach.

Items.Name: caveShovel
Items.Description: A shovel found in the chimney room. Too large to fit through the low crawl.

Items.Name: coal
Items.Description: A piece of coal from the coal mine. You will need this.

Items.Name: parchmentMap
Items.Description: A very old parchment map from the tomb room. It contains valuable information about treasure locations.
